snippet: Lobbyists were in a tizzy over provisions of a Senate-passed ethics bill that tighten regulation of lobbying and require secretive “political intelligence” firms to register as lobbyists do.
abstract: House Republicans vow to strengthen a Senate-passed ethics bill, intended to ban insider trading by members of Congress privy to confidential information they receive as lawmakers; Democratic members of Congress charge that Republican efforts, shaped by corporate lobbyists, will weaken the legislation and increase the cynicism of the American public.
lead_paragraph: Lobbyists were in a tizzy over provisions of a Senate-passed ethics bill that tighten regulation of lobbying and require secretive “political intelligence” firms to register as lobbyists do.

headline.seo: Ban on Insider Trading by Congress Faces G.O.P. Revisions in House
headline.main: Ban on Insider Trading Faces G.O.P. Revisions
headline.print_headline: Ban on Insider Trading Faces G.O.P. Revisions
